newsitem.title: LATVIA: O/N RATES UP, LAT-DOLLAR SEEN STABLE.
newsitem.headline: O/N RATES UP, LAT-DOLLAR SEEN STABLE.

text.p: Latvian overnight rates were high for the start of the month as banks scrambled to meet liquidity requirements and the lat-dollar was seen stable on a quiet market laid low by summer, dealers said on Wednesday.
Overnight rates climbed on Wednesday to 3.50/4.50 from 3.30/4.30 on Tuesday and the market was very active.
"We borrowed three to four million lats on the overnight market on Tuesday and other banks were also very active," a dealer with Hansabank-Latvija told Reuters.
"Usually rates are not so high at the start of the month, but banks seem to be a little short on lats at the moment," she added.
Dealers cited a 12 million lat syndicated loan to Latellekom last month as a reason behind the slight shortage of lats.
In currency markets, the central bank's lat-dollar rate edged up to 0.5706/0.5822 from 0.5706/0.5821 in the morning. The commercial bank rates were close at 0.5719/0.5723.
Dealers said that the market was very quiet because of summer and that future fluctuations would be determined by the dollar's movements against other major currencies.
Dealers said that no big local deals were looming on the horizon which would push up demand for either dollars or lats.
